title: Crashing + blue lines
body:
I recently moved. After re-setting up my desktop, making sure everything was plugged in, I thought it was fine. I went to play some LoL a day later, and about 20 seconds into the game, my computer "froze". ctrl+alt+del did nothing, nor anything else. 

When it froze, blue horizontal "lines" appeared on the screen. The way they were formated it looked like a combination of periods/decimals and hyphens to give them a curvature, kind of like a sine wave.

Anyway, I figured it was a graphics issue, so I reinstalled my drivers. I played a game, it was fine.

I go to play another game, and it does the same thing. Now that I've restarted once more, my resolution on my screen as shrunk, and the same lines are now ever-present, only their color changes with whats on the screen.

I'm thinking it's a problem with my graphics card, but I'm not the most tech-savvy in the world.

replies.body:
It definitely sounds like this could be a potential hardware failure situation. There are a number of steps that can be taken to troubleshoot it, so I recommend working through the steps in our [Crash guide](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201761974-Bug-Splat-and-Game-Crashes) as I believe some of those may resolve this.

Let me know if those steps caused any changed.
